meanings.definition: A person who raises trivial objections or engages in petty argumentation.
meanings.sent1: The quibbler in the meeting kept interrupting with small complaints.
meanings.sent2: The office quibbler always finds something to nitpick about.
meanings.sent3: The quibbler at the party made everyone laugh with their silly arguments.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was a quibbler, always finding faults in her plans.
meanings.sent5: The quibbler's constant objections became tiresome for everyone around.

meanings.definition: To argue or raise objections about trivial matters.
meanings.sent1: She would quibble over the smallest details in the contract.
meanings.sent2: He tends to quibble about the prices at the grocery store.
meanings.sent3: The siblings would quibble playfully over who got the bigger slice of cake.
meanings.sent4: The team members quibbled over the best strategy to use in the game.
meanings.sent5: The students quibbled about the assignment deadline until the teacher clarified it.
